fields.description:
Good Morning,
Following all the steps to configure and clone a repository with SSH always gives the following error.

Command: git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false --no-optional-locks ls-remote git@bitbucket.org:siscard/vulcano.peru.git
Output: 
Error: FATAL ERROR: Network error: Connection refused
fatal: Could not read from remote repository.

Please make sure you have the correct access rights
and the repository exists.
fields.summary: This is not a valid source path / URL

fields.description:
Hi,

I am trying to install SourceTree in window 10 which is failing, I have tried archived versions and the latest one but no luck, attaching the log file for your ease.
fields.summary: SourceTree Login in after Installing on Window 10 is loading for ever.

fields.description:
Since applying the latest beta (3.3.2-beta-3742) remotes are no longer refreshed automatically. They only update when I manually perform an operation (e.g press Fetch on the toolbar).

I have the following Options set

Options->General-> (/) Check default remotes for updates every 10 minutes

Repository Settings->Remotes->Remote details-> (/) Default remote

Repository Settings->Advanced->(/) Automatically Refresh

Repository Settings->Advanced->(/) Refresh remote status in the background
fields.summary: Remotes are no longer refreshing automatically

fields.description:
SourceTree Windows 3.2.6 running on Windows 10.

(Windows 10 is running as VM on Parallels Desktop on macOS 10,16)

In SourceTree Windows, do Tools | Options | Git

Push Branches option is set to "matching"

Change the Push Branches option to any other value, such as "upstream"

Click OK

Reopen the options dialog with Tools | Options | Git

The Push Branches option is still set to "matching" instead of "upstream" (FAIL).
fields.summary: Push Branches option update is not saved.

fields.description: I run windows 10 in high contrast mode with a dark window background. Doing so renders text in the branches tree black on a grey background, which is hard to read. Unselected tags and remotes are rendered in grey on a grey background, making them impossible to read.
fields.summary: Branches, tags, remotes hard to read in high-contrast mode

fields.description:
I'm trying to pull some code from Bitbucket using SourceTree and I keep getting an authentication error. I've spent a few hours troubleshooting anything I could find in the community forums and I still have not found a solution. 

This is the error:

git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false --no-optional-locks fetch origin
git: 'credential-osxkeychain' is not a git command. See 'git --help'.
fatal: remote error: CAPTCHA required
Your Bitbucket account has been locked. To unlock it and log in again you must
solve a CAPTCHA. This is typically caused by too many attempts to login with an
incorrect password. The account lock prevents your SCM client from accessing
Bitbucket and its mirrors until it is solved, even if you enter your password
correctly.
fields.summary: SourceTree CAPTCHA Error

fields.description: It will be perfect to allow '/' in branch names
fields.summary: Backslashed in branch names

fields.description:
*Preconditions:* 

"Gmail" app installed on device and set as default email app of device.

*Steps to reproduce:*

*Case 1* 

1. Open app "Железнодорожные билеты" on IOS.  

2. Go to "Еще" tab.

3. Click on "E-mail".

NOTE: Tested device iPhone 7 (IOS 13.1.2).

*Case 2*

1. Open app "Железнодорожные билеты" on Android.  

2. Go to "Поддержка" tab.

3. Click on "E-mail".

 NOTE: Tested device OnePlus 5 (Android 9.0.0).

 

*Expected result:* 

*Case 1/2*

Redirection to default device E-mail app should be done.

 

*Actual result:* 

*Case 1*

Any redirect option is not opened.

*Case 2*

Default share option is opened.
fields.summary: "Железнодорожные билеты" incorrect functionality of "Mail to" option

fields.description:
|*Steps to reproduce:*
1. Open app "Железнодорожные билеты".  
2. Go to "Билеты" tab.
3. Swipe inner tabs of "Билеты" option to the left/right.
NOTE: in Android version actual bug is not reproducible. Inner tabs are swipeable to the left/right. 
Tested devices: iPhone 7 (IOS 13.1.2), OnePlus 5 (Android 9.0.0)
*Expected result:* Inner tabs should be swipeable to the left/right.
*Actual result:* Inner tabs are not swipeable to the left/right.|
fields.summary: "Железнодорожные билеты" non swipeable tabs in "Билеты" app option in IOS version

fields.description:
I run windows 10 in high contrast mode with a dark window background. Doing so renders text in the branches tree black on a grey background, which is hard to read. Unselected tags and remotes are rendered in grey on a grey background, making them impossible to read.

High contrast settings:

!image-2019-10-21-12-03-31-470.png!

Sourcetree 3.2.6 (not 3.2.2 as I had to select below) GUI

!image-2019-10-21-12-04-12-396.png!
fields.summary: Unreadable text in high contrast mode

fields.description: The window in the lower right that shows differences between files needs the ability to select text to copy to the clipboard.  That way, it's easy to paste elsewhere, such as when searching for it in a code editor, etc.
fields.summary: Allow "Copy" from the diff view in Sourcetree

fields.description:
Version: 3.2.6

The search function stops working after a while.

Repo Steps:

1) type in part of a known file name

2) see the results

3) use the BackSpace key to delete the previous search

4) repeat these step, about 3-4 times. The search stops working.

 

Actually, it appears that the search stops working as soon as the results returns back nothing. I have to close the search box and change commits a few times before the search box starts working again.
fields.summary: The History Search Is Almost Worthless

fields.description:
I am getting constant login prompts and still cant access repositories. Incorrect name or password message. I can login via browser or using  tools like GitExt. But even using gitext prompts me to enter password 2 to 3 times 

Real pain

Please help
fields.summary: Can't access bitbucket using sourcetree

fields.description:
We have migrated from Mercurial and several of our web URL filenames have special UNICODE characters (like: \273 and \267).

*Issue 1*
 However, when these files are checked-out the UNICODE character (\302) is being appended to the other UNICODE character. Thus
{code:java}
\273
{code}
is being convert to
{code:java}
\302\273
{code}
thus the files looks as if they have been renamed, when in fact they haven't.

 

*Issue 2*

While trying to stage these files (using SourceTree), we get the following error:
{code:java}
git
-c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false --no-optional-locks rm -q -f --
ThinkTecture/IdentityManager/Home � IdentityManager-IdentityManager Wiki.url
fatal: pathspec 'ThinkTecture/IdentityManager/Home � IdentityManager-IdentityManager Wiki.url' did not match any files
Completed with errors, see above.
{code}
However, we can stage them if we use git -A from bash. 



We have SourceTree's Git Version set to System. 

2.23.0/LibGit2Sharp 0.25.4+g06e64a2235.libgit2-4aecb64 + git-lfs v2.8.0

Path: c:\program files\git\cmd\git.exe
fields.summary: Special Unicode Character in Filename

fields.description:

1. Open [https://gamelayer.ru/igra-tanchiki-dendi-s-redaktorom-kart.html]

2. Accept Flash Player using

**4. Push Enter (1 player)

5. Move your tank to left bottom corner (use keyboard arrows)

6. Push Space (Fire)

*Expected result:* Tank is firing

*Actual result:* Tank is not firing

fields.summary: CAPTCHA ERROR

fields.description:
Is there a plan to show stage/unstage files in a tree so that I can expand/collapse all files in a folder. 

In our projects, there are some of files that we don't want to see them even these are display in the unstage list and we cannot set them in .gitingore files.

A good way is to collapse them. Currently, I have to select only a few files in lots of items and it's a trouble for me.

 

Thanks,
fields.summary: stage/unstage files showing like a tree

fields.description:
Greetings, I don't know exactly if this has been done specially, but as for me it's not normal and uncomfortable:

At the right bottom part of the SourceTree window I have panel, showing added/deleted strings of the code. Sometimes strings are too long to see them in that panel, so I need a horizontal scrollbar. The problem is that it is hidden until the vertical scrollbar is moved down to the end in both fullscreen or scaled window mode. 

Horizontal scrollbar is hidden:

!image-2019-10-09-14-44-26-846.png!

 

Horizontal scrollbar appears after scrolling down to the end:

!image-2019-10-09-14-47-55-931.png!

 

Hope, that you agree with me, so it'll be fixed soon)
fields.summary: Hidden scrollbar on the History tab

fields.description:
My custom actions are completely broken in the latest Beta-3.3.0-3678.

Following is just one example of many of my custom actions that no longer function. Custom actions have always been a bit screwy as can be seen by the fact I need to use this batch file (bashRunCmd.bat) to work around oddities with the way the parameters are passed.

This particular script just opens a command prompt window in Beta 3.3.0. It works fine in SourceTree for Windows 3.2.6.

Reflog
 Script to run: C:\git\tools\bashRuncmd.bat
 Parameters: C:\git\tools\git-merge-abort.sh $REPO

bashRuncmd.bat:
 SET mypath=%~dp0
 start "C:\Program Files\Git\git-bash.exe" %1 %2 %3 %4 %5

git-merge-abort.sh:
 #!/bin/bash
 git merge --abort

And by the way why can't you guys get this JIRA system figured out? The "Affects version/s" field contains a list of versions which doesn't even include the latest released versions. 
 The version I was forced to put in there is inaccurate.

 

1. Custom actions not displaying executions, nothing happens on click.
2. Custom action with multiple parameters are set .(In the parameter field, “$SHA  $FILE” was used.)  And right click on one file of one commit and choose custom action , but  the custom action I made earlier with single parameter was NOT displayed.
fields.summary: Custom Actions broken in Beta-3.3.0-3678

fields.description:
I can't use both $ SHA and $ FILE in custom actions.
When both $ SHA and $ FILE are specified like the attached image, nothing is displayed in the custom action of the context menu on the main screen of Source Tree. (If one is specified, it will operate normally.)

 

Source tree Ver3.2.6 on Windows 10（Version 10.0.18362.356）

!image-2019-10-07-13-51-33-513.png!
fields.summary: Can't use both $ SHA and $ FILE in custom actions.

fields.description: When using a private Bitbucket server and updating Sourcetree Windows client from 3.1.3 to 3.2.6 results in remote repositories (of private server) no longer being listed (empty screen). Rolling back to 3.1.3 restores list viewing capability.
fields.summary: Remote Repositories List Empty (Bitbucket private server)

fields.description:
I'm using version{color:#FF0000} 3.2.6{color}. (this version is not selectable in the Affects Version/s box).

External diff does not do anything anymore.

My global .gitconfig does NOT contain the [diff]  and [difftool]  sections.

In preferences the 'SystemDefault' does not do anything. And if I select WinMerge which I always used, also nothing works (I triple checked the location of the winmerge executable).
fields.summary: External Diff not working anymore

fields.description:
Dear Support,

 

There might be an easy solution to this, in the "Finish Xxxx" dialog (as in Finish Feature) there are a set of options, like: Rebase on development branch etc. Just add another option called "Create Pull Request" which would pass the other options to the pull request page (so these options can be applied during the pull request stage). Then when the user clicks the OK button the pull request page is launched (almost like you get when using: Shift+Alt+P) and the dialog code clean up/removes the GitFlow tracking status from the local system. I understand it isn't perfect but at lest it is headed in the right direction. :)

Edit: I notice that you track the gitflow status in _.git\config_. For example: if I have a feature called _Test_, then I would have the following added to my _config_ file:
{code:java}
[gitflow "branch.feature/Test"]
    base = dev{code}
So there would need to be an extra property called something like, pullRequested=true. This would allow a follow up dialog box to run something like _git flow feature delete Test_.

Thus the gitflow steps change from 2 steps to 3 steps (if the pull request option was chosen). This, I think, is something we could live with.

Any thoughts or suggestions?

(Originally posted [here|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BCLOUD-17710?focusedCommentId=2285141&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel#comment-2285141])
fields.summary: GitFlow needs to work with Pull Requests

[https://s.mail.ru/N8ry/JnkmGhh57]

 

Not branches for select

 

version 3.2.6 https://s.mail.ru/JCUy/77dnSoig9

fields.description:
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false --no-optional-locks push -v --tags origin master:master
remote: Forbidden
fatal: unable to access 'https://fahri_lana@bitbucket.org/fkurniawan/bimba-update.git/': The requested URL returned error: 403

Pushing to https://fahri_lana@bitbucket.org/fkurniawan/bimba-update.git
Completed with errors, see above.

fields.description: When I add or modify files locally, Source Tree does not seem to register those changes. The File Status tab says "Nothing to commit". Any thoughts?
fields.summary: Sourcetree does not register local file changes

fields.description:
It would be great to have a filter (a regex filter would be even better) on the staging panels/view for sourcetree.

Quite often when I've merged in a branch, there are significant changes from other sources that want to wipe some of my changes. If there was a filter I could filter by extension as an example that I can make bulk decisions about files I didn't touch at all. Then I can work on the specific files that I need to focus on.
fields.summary: Staging Area Filter

fields.description:
!image-2019-10-04-13-50-19-987.png!

 

When trying to amend a commit from Commit options... a dialog appears
{quote}Replace commit text?
Do you want to replace the commit text above with the message from the previous commit?
[Yes] [No]
{quote}
This is misleading as what this dialog actually does is that when I choose to not replace my new commit message, it cancels the amend command and creates new commit instead.

 

What is wrong here is that I do want to amend a previous commit, but I don't want my new commit message replaced with the old one.
fields.summary: Misleading popup dialog when amending commit

fields.description:
Please implement the option

--allow-unrelated-histories

 

Thanks
fields.summary: --allow-unrelated-histories

fields.description:
Hi Atlassian Support 

I am having a trouble connecting to our enterprise Bitbucket Server from the source tree client. 

It fails at the Registration section when it prompts me to enter the Root URL and Username. 

Triage I did, deleted all the windows credentials from the local system. Tried with both of the protocols, ssh and https; but no luck. 

 

These are the versions of tool used : 

 

Source Tree --3.1.3_001

Enterprise Bitbucket server 
 * Atlassian Bitbucket v5.9.1

Windows 10

Supporting Browser --Google Chrome
fields.summary: Not able to connect Bitbucket server from Source Tree client

fields.description:
Whenever I'm trying to create a new branch through the hg flow process, it get the following error message:

The name is invalid. Ref names must follow git ref-format rules: 
https://www.kernel.org/pub/software/scm/git/docs/git-check-ref-format.html
Completed with errors, see above.

Note: It does work if I don't use spaces...
fields.summary: New branch through hg flow throws error

fields.description:
The line that can be grabbed and dragged with mouse to adjust the size of the "Staged files" and "Unstaged files" panels is literally 1 pixel wide. This results in very bad UX because it requires extremely precise mouse maneuvering (especially on a 4k monitor).

 

The "adjust handle" area should be a lot wider, like it is in the rest of the app - other adjustable panel borders do not seem to have this issue.
fields.summary: The adjustable border line between staged and unstaged sections is 1 pixel wide

fields.description:
Regarding change log 3.3.0-beta-3678: "Flow actions can now only be started for the latest dev branch" in the change log:

 

Why would I want to start a git flow feature branch from the current active branch? What was so wrong with automatic branching from develop? That's git flow right? Now I first have to switch branches, then start a feature branch. Same what would happen before but then automatic? When I want to make a hotfix branch, I have to switch to master first instead of ST doing that for me regardless the branch I am on (when everything is commited).

 

So whats the point in initializing git flow and setting desired branches, when I have to do this by hand? Is it really intended this way now?

With a detached head there is not branch selected in the drop down.
fields.summary: Git flow not automatically branching from correct branch

fields.description:
Cherry-pick allows committing the changes but there is no way to push the changes from SourceTree. The workaround seems to be to not commit as part of cherry-pick and then commit and push separately.

This is for v3.2.6
fields.summary: Cherry-pick does not provide an option to push the commit

fields.description:
When you create two patches from commits with option "Create a separate patch file per commit" activated with Sourcetree, you get :

patch1.diff (the most recent one)

patch2.diff (the oldest one)

 

If you do it directly from git with "git format-patch HEAD~2", you get :

0001-My-oldest-commit-message.patch

0002-My-most-recent-commit-message.patch

 

I find the git result way better. Can you improve the way Sourcetree manage this ?
fields.summary: Names for patches

fields.description:
!image-2019-09-24-18-58-41-300.png!

 

Right Sides code view horizontal scroll is hiding in the last part of the file.

Due to this the code hiding in horizontal way cannot be viewed immediately. The code has to be scrolled vertically to the bottom and then the horizontal scroll has to be used.
fields.summary: Code scroll not proper in horizontal way

fields.description:
I'm having this very problem on Windows 7 (2.6.10).  I'm seeing in the repo config file that lower case 'f' instead of the upper case 'F' in Feature when branches are made.  I don't have the windows OS folder set to the word feature/Feature.  I just work in the same folder and switch branches as the need arises.  The REMOTES/Origin section of the UI shows lower case 'feature' while my windows 10 machine shows upper case 'Feature'. 

Picking 'critical' since this is not apparently happening in the UI as they are named the same only to have two different branches attempting to achieve the same effort while both are missing the changes of the other.  This is effecting more than 50 developers where I work.
fields.summary: SourceTree ignores case on Branch name and pushes 'new' branch

fields.description:
Visual Studio Online's git repositories are case sensitive.  Occasionally someone creates a branch with the first letter upper case, such as "Feature/homepage".  When I pull this branch is SourceTree, the local branch name appears as "feature/homepage".  When I push changes to VSO, SourceTree pushes the lower case name and VSO creates a new branch that is all lower case.  Then we have two branches with the same name, only separated by case.   SourceTree still only shows one branch (the lower case one) and gives an error when trying to push to it again.  

I would like SourceTree for Windows to recognize and preserve the case, whatever it may be.
fields.summary: SourceTree ignores case of remote branch, and lowers the case on push

fields.description:
Windows 10 Pro. Display setting - 200% scale (4K monitor).

Custom window chrome has one issue at that scale - the thin border of 1px around the window, which prevents system actions buttons (minimize, maximize, etc.) to work same as other Windows 10 apps do.

When the app window is maximized, the system buttons must be aligned to the top of the screen (check system Windows 10 apps or Google Chrome that has custom chrome). However, SourceTree app for Windows keeps that 1px border around the window even in maximized state, which prevents system buttons to accept clicks when mouse is at y = 0.

This is very annoying, because when you minimize/restore/close the maximized window, you normally move the mouse pointer to the topmost position of the screen and click quickly.
fields.summary: Custom chrome issue on hi-dpi screen

fields.description: When I do a Fetch or a Commit do not appear any pull or push respectively. I try to unistall the programme and reinstall, but the issue is still there. What should I do to solve it?
fields.summary: Problems when pushing and pulling

fields.description: We receive feedback from a number of different sources and evaluate those when we plan our product roadmap.
fields.summary: Allow Organization admins to exclude specific email addresses from SAML

fields.description:
When a user is working on a git repository and:
1. Clicks the Branch button
2. Types in a branch name that start with "/" (ex: "/users/urig/some-feature")
3. Clicks the Create branch button.
Then he/she is presented with an error message saying:
fields.summary: Allow branch names that start with '/'

fields.description:
Go to file status. Have a folder with 2+ files visible.

Current behaviour:
if you select every files in this folder, the folder is ticked.
if you select files in this folder, but not all of them the folder is not ticked. This can lead to commit files without knowing it.

Wished behaviour:
if you select every files in this folder, the folder is ticked.
if you select files in this folder, but not all of them the folder is ticked with a light grey tick (as in previous tree versions).
fields.summary: File status > Tree view: folders partially selected should be ticked with a grey tick

fields.description:
Go to file status. Have a folder with 2+ files visible.

Current behaviour:
if you select every files in this folder, the folder is ticked.
if you select files in this folder, but not all of them the folder is not ticked. This can lead to commit files without knowing it.
fields.summary: ree view: folders partially selected should be ticked with a grey tick

fields.description:
SourceTree on Windows
Version 3.2.6

STR:
# Create new branch (Branch -> Create Branch, "Checkout New Branch" is checked)
# Commit something (without checking "Push changes immediately to...")
# Click Push button
# Check the local branch that I'm on

ER:
# Remote branch field is not empty, name of the local branch is being filled automatically
# Pressing Push creates a remote branch with the same name as local branch

AR:
# Remote branch field is empty
# If I type the name of the local branch into Remote branch field, Push doesn't work

Note: It worked previously as it is the flow that I was using regularly.
fields.summary: Push new branch to remote doesn't work

fields.description:
We need to see our private GitHub repos from Sourcetree, so that our team can quickly clone code. We weren't able to see them on Mac or Windows. Luckily the [Mac version of this ticket|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREE-6322?jql=text%20~%20%22Remotes%20only%20display%20public%20github%20repos%22] has a workaround, but I do not see anything for the Windows version. We have authenticated using OAuth and Basic, neither of which allowed us to see the repos. I confirmed that GitHub is showing that we have full permissions. Our team in NOT an organization on GitHub.

!image-2019-09-20-08-24-50-460.png|width=510,height=499!

 

Just upgraded to latest beta version (3.2.0-beta-3444) and it is still occurring.
fields.summary: Remote not showing private GitHub repos

fields.description:
NOTE: I can only select version "3.2.4 (unreleased)" in your version dropdown, but the installed version is 3.2.6 - please also fix this :)

!image-2019-09-20-10-05-11-530.png!

Steps to reproduce:
 # add files to staging
 # enter commit message
 # press commit => Crash

 Log:

ERROR [2019-09-19 11:14:33,742] [1] [SourceTree.Analytics.Crash.BugSplat.CrashAnalyticsService] [Log] - DispatcherUnhandledExceptionHandler for [Sourcetree, 3.2.6.3544] called with [System.Windows.Threading.Dispatcher, System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherUnhandledExceptionEventArgs]
 System.Reflection.TargetInvocationException: Exception has been thrown by the target of an invocation. ---> System.Windows.Markup.XamlParseException: Set property 'System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Style' threw an exception. ---> System.InvalidOperationException: 'TextBlock' TargetType does not match type of element 'Label'.
 at System.Windows.Style.CheckTargetType(Object element)
 at System.Windows.StyleHelper.UpdateStyleCache(FrameworkElement fe, FrameworkContentElement fce, Style oldStyle, Style newStyle, Style& styleCache)

fields.description: I have my sourcetree connect to Bitbucket and I am able to see the remote repositories from bitbucket. Now I am trying to connect to AWS code commit but when I try to add an account on remote repositories section, I do not see aws codecommit option in drop drown. Please help me.
fields.summary: Not able to connect with AWS CodeCommit

fields.description:
Double-clicking a project to open it moves the project from its current folder to “no folder” destroying its relationship to other projects. The _only_ solution to this bug  is to use the context menu to open the project, which doesn’t work either. In other words, there is no direct user solution to either bug since one is the solution to to the other

 

The indirect workaround is , then open the “no folder” project, then drag the project back to the folder where it belongs. When there are more projects than fit on the screen, and when the “no folder” project has to be dragged up above the visible display, then it is impossible to drag the project back to where it belongs. Atlasian failed to implement “drag scroll” for drag & drop making it impossible to drag above visible.
fields.summary: Double-clicking a project to open it moves the project from its current folder to “no folder”

fields.description: The context menu "Open" does not do anything at all
fields.summary: Context menu "Open"

fields.description: When a commit message exceeds a certain amount (dont know how long) it bugsplats
fields.summary: When a commit message is too long it bug splats
Using external working directory causes staging changes to produces unpredictable results.

fields.description:
When merging one branch into another where there is at least one conflicted file, discarding the conflicted file results in SourceTree completely aborting the merge.

 
 # Merge one branch into another resulting in at least one conflicted file.
 # Right click on a conflicted file in the staging area and click Discard.  (In previous versions of SourceTree, this simply discarded the changes, reverting the file to the state before the merge was started)
 # SourceTree completely aborts the merge.  If I had already resolved conflicts in other files, the resolved files are completely lost.

 

Sourcetree should never automatically abort a merge no matter what files are discarded or resolved.

 

The workflow we use at my company results in there being a conflict on a certain special file on nearly every merge which cannot be merged normally.  (don't ask)  To work around this, normally we just discard the conflicted file.  Anyway, this breaks our workflow and has resulted in lost productivity several times due to having to resolve conflicts multiple times.  

This is not an issue in SourceTree for Windows v3.1.3
fields.summary: Merge aborted unexpectedly

fields.description:
h1. Environment
 - SourceTree Version: 3.2.6

h1. Steps To Reproduce
 # Clone a repository that already has Git LFS enabled.
 # Open a terminal console.
 # Enable Git LFS hooks via: {{git lfs install}}
 # Create a new +case-insensitive+ filter.
 -- For example: {{git lfs track "*.[Zz][Ii][Pp]"}}
 -- After this change, _Source Tree_ should be reporting that {{.gitattributes}} has changed.
 --- If not, then ensure that Git tracking has been enabled for {{.gitattributes}}
 -- *Note:* At this state _Source Tree_ will mark any existing files that match the newly created filter as "modified"... so the filter works.
 # If desired, push the changes back to the remote server.
 # Add a new file to the repository - the newly created filter should match the file's extension.
 -- For example: {{NewCompressedFile.zip}}

h2. Expected Result
 # You should be able to add the newly created file to a commit, and
 # when the operation is complete the file should be stored in LFS.

h2. Actual Result
 - When you try to add the newly created file to a commit, _Source Tree_ will display the following error...
fields.summary: SourceTree incorrectly reports that a file is not tracked for Git LFS.

fields.description: 3.2.6 crash when commit
fields.summary: 3.2.6 crash when commit

fields.description:
I went from V3.1.3 to v3.2.6 and I am not unable to open any repository.  The application reports no issues and shows no sign of attempting to open anything.

Windows 10 - 10.0.17763 running on a Dell i5-6300U.

I have uninstalled 3.2.6 and reinstalled 3.1.3, I can now open my repos.
fields.summary: Unable to open repo v3.2.6

fields.description: It would be great if right-clicking the last (or perhaps any) commit displayed a UI to change the comment on the commit.
fields.summary: Amend Comment on Previous Commit

fields.description:
When you have the same Git repo checked out several times, and need to look at the submodules for them, each submodule tab has the same name and makes the UX very confusing - you can't tell which tab refers to which repo. I'd suggest naming them like "MainRepo - Submodule" or perhaps giving each tab some indicator (colour, icon, whatever) and repeating this on the submodule tabs. Or even have the submodule tabs open as tabs within the main repo page.

 

Thanks!
fields.summary: Enable naming / colouring of submodule tabs

fields.description:
If my credentials to my Bitbucket server have expired / account locked, my initial commit& push action would be incomplete. it will complete the commit but push fails.

Once I resolve my credential issue outside Sourcetree, I was able to do one Pull to confirm the creds on Sourcetree are updated.

Now, If just invoke the Push action, the latest version of Sourcetree is not letting me do this. Instead showing nothing to push as empty line. I had to do one more commit&push to let the previous commits to go along to the Bitbucket server as push.

In previous version of Sourcetree (not sure if it was just 1 version before), I was able to Push my failed pushed once I resolve the creds issue.

Sorry, I could not attach the screenshots as I work in client place
fields.summary: Push not allowed after initial commit+push failed

fields.description:
In the "Ignore" dialog, it seems like it would be more intuitive if the "Ignore everything beneath" radio option was selected automatically when a directory is selected from the dropdown next to it.

This change would eliminate a step when ignoring a directory.
fields.summary: Automatically select option for "Ignore everything beneath"

fields.description: MySQL is more than just a database server. This Launchpad project acts as an umbrella for all projects related to (and including) the MySQL Server.
fields.summary: Projects related to the World's most popular Open Source Database

fields.description:
When a user sets the due date and target date to the same day, Portfolio will show the following error and user will be unable to commit the changes:
h3. Environment

Jira Portfolio 3.9.X
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue in plan.
 # Expose "Due Date" in the scope.
 # Set a due date value.
 # Set the same day in the "Target End" field.
fields.summary: same date for Target End and Due Date will trigger warning

fields.description: Use Case: Our company decided to change the way they were handling certain returns issues. The old way was valid but less efficient and caused occasional confusion for the warehouse associates. The new way is more uniform, streamlined, and contains fewer exceptions. Jira tickets for investigation into the cause of each instance are handled very differently and for a while during implementation both processes will exist. The old process will go away after a while so users should no longer be allowed to create those tickets after that point.
fields.summary: would have the effect of being able to obsolete an issue type within a project(s) without changing existing tickets

fields.description:
When I use SourceTree, I often notice degraded OS performance. When I check the Task Manager, I see numerous listings for "Git for Windows (32 bit)" running, followed shortly by a host of "Git Credential Manager for Windows".

Though I appreciate that SourceTree wants to see if there are updates to my repos, I wouldn't expect it to allow this many connections at once. Further, I only have six tabs (currently) open, indicating that I'm not really all that worried about updates to more than those six repos.
fields.summary: Sourcetree shouldn't floor my CPU, & especially not when it's not being used

fields.description:
It would be cooperative if on the subject type scheme an effective date range could be configured for issue types such that for projects where that issue type scheme is used, certain issue types can only be selected by users during the configured date interval.

 This would have the effect of being able to obsolete an issue type within a project(s) without changing existing tickets.

 Use Case: Our company decided to change the way they were handling certain returns issues. The old way was valid but less efficient and caused occasional confusion for the warehouse associates. The new way is more uniform, streamlined, and contains fewer exceptions. Jira tickets for investigation into the cause of each instance are handled very differently and for a while during implementation both processes will exist. The old process will go away after a while so users should no longer be allowed to create those tickets after that point.
fields.summary: Enhance Real Date Choice to Issue Type in Issue Type Scheme

fields.description: Every time I click tag details I would like to copy some info from the window but none of that info is selectable. Can you put all of that in one big text box (in tag details window)?
fields.summary: Tag details need to have selectable lables

All remotes are setup correctly. The pushes via terminal are received on the GIT server flawlessly.

fields.description:
Untracked branches cannot be pushed to remotes because they do not appear in the list of branches on the _Push_ modal. This worked on v3.2.0-beta (and every version before that), but does not work on v3.2.6.

This is a critical bug and makes Sourcetree unusable.

 

This is v3.2.0-beta:

!st-push-untracked-3.2.0-beta.gif!

 

This is 3.2.6:

!st-push-untracked-3.2.6.gif!
fields.summary: Untracked branches cannot be pushed

--content
﻿﻿a
b

--binary view
00000000:	efbb	bfef	bbbf	efbb
00000008:	bf61	0d0a	62
fields.summary: Invalid char while copy text from File Contents area

fields.description:
Telemetry for Sourcetree (Windows) can be disabled via unchecking the option:

{noformat}
General
   Misc
      [ ] Help improve Sourcetree by sending anonymous data about your usage
{noformat}

It would be ideal to allow a Windows group policy to configure this value instead of having each individual user adjust the option.
fields.summary: support system policy configuring telemetry setting

fields.description:
When I have the window maximized at 2560x1440 resolution the commit button and commit options on the right side of the screen are not clickable. Likely there's some sort of UI component blocking clicks on the bottom right.
 * Open source tree
 * Maximize at 2560x1440
 * Commit button among other things is not clickable.

To fix this I have to unmaximize the window so I can click the button.

This regression happens in 3.2.4/3.2.6.
fields.summary: Commit button is not clickable when maximized.

fields.summary: No TAG saved (with spaces) on GitFlow finish release

fields.description:
I've seen several other discussions on a similar topic but none of them or their resolutions resolved this issue.
 # I started with an issue in JIRA
 # I clicked "create branch"
 # Followed the form to clone from a master branch.
 # Clicked the "Check out in Sourctree" button.

Sourcetree opens and I'm presented with the main Sourcetree window, an orange Error "This is not a valid source path / URL" and a blue "URL Actions" window.

Steps I have taken to attempt resolution are below. I re-attempted after each step.
 # I have git installed on my machine and have tried switching to embedded git in Sourcetree.
 # I enabled and downloaded embedded Mercurial in Sourcetree.
 # I've successfully configured my SSH key and can view and clone and fetch repos from bitbucket within Sourcetree directly.
 # I switched to an App Password and verified connectivity.
 # I changed my authentication protocol to HTTPS and verified connectivity.
 # I switched my authentication to basic and verified connectivity.

I consistently get the same error message and am unable to check out the branch in Sourcetree.
fields.summary: 'That is not a valid source path / URL' when clicking "Check out in Sourcetree" from bitbucket

fields.description:
Bug is hard to reproduce. This happens rarely. However I am seeing it from time to time. Commit details field is becoming white.

I will attach screenshot.
fields.summary: Dark Theme: not working in history commit details (ST 3.2.5.3517)

fields.description:
My Sourcetree crashes when attempting to commit my .gitignore file to my branch off master.

I have attached my sourcetree.log with the exception I keep getting.

The last exception in the log at the bottom is the one I keep getting when I try to commit my file.
fields.summary: Sourcetree crashes when attempting to commit file
